channel.title: Questions about Inquisitor
channel.description:
Hello everyone. I am a new player here who got Inquisitor 4 times yesterday. Loving both factionless classes and investigative ones, I quickly learned to love Inq. However, a few hypothetical scenarios got me thinking: 1) What happens if the Sorcerer becomes Neutral King? Does it become impossible for Inquisitors to win, or can they still kill a magic neutral king? 2) After an Inquisitor kills a Sorcerer, if they become Neutral King, can they still lose? 3) Does Cult King die if Inq attacks him?
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Questions about Inquisitor
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
alcoholic becoming king does not lose the ability to see who unseen are, I don’t think sorcerer gains the ability to do so

Read full topic

item.title: Questions about Inquisitor
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
Morkimus:

Huh? I am fairly certain as an Evil King (Alcoholic stepping up) I was able to see the members+conversions of the Unseen. Is the Sorcerer still alone, despite being evil?

To my knowledge I don’t think the evil king see’s the conversions that take place after getting promoted to king. I think he just keeps the current unseen/cult that he knew about before stepping up for king. Either way though if he does keep it, it’s a continuation of having been a former member of unseen/cult. Starting evil king does not know unseen/cult beyond what he investigates. Pretty sure sorc becoming evil king is more or less the same

Read full topic

item.title: Questions about Inquisitor
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Sorcerer is still alone. Kinda like starting evil king.

Read full topic

item.title: Questions about Inquisitor
item.dc:creator: Morkimus
item.description:
Huh? I am fairly certain as an Evil King (Alcoholic stepping up) I was able to see the members+conversions of the Unseen. Is the Sorcerer still alone, despite being evil?

Read full topic

item.title: Questions about Inquisitor
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
No. Evil king doesn’t learn who the unseen are

Read full topic

item.title: Questions about Inquisitor
item.dc:creator: Morkimus
item.description:
That’s interesting. So a Sorcerer can instantly learn about the Unseen/Cult members identities by becoming king… And slightly change their win condition.

Thank you all for the replies

Read full topic

item.title: Questions about Inquisitor
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
They are in fact evil king.

Read full topic

1. Sorcerer isn’t a neutral king - they are an evil king
  2. Not sure
  3. I think yes?

item.title: Questions about Inquisitor
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
The BD are the ones that can attack the king at night. The inquis isn’t BD just like the NK’s and Evils.

Read full topic

item.title: Questions about Inquisitor
item.dc:creator: Morkimus
item.description:
I was actually able to attack Cult King in a game once the Sorc was down. I just chose not to because he was going to be executed the next day and I’d rather get someone else.

Read full topic

item.title: Questions about Inquisitor

item.description:
1. I think you can’t select king but win as long as he gets executed
  2. why would you become a neutral king after winning?
  3. I don’t think in can select king with abilities

item.title: Questions about Inquisitor
item.dc:creator: Morkimus
item.description:
Hello everyone. I am a new player here who got Inquisitor 4 times yesterday. Loving both factionless classes and investigative ones, I quickly learned to love Inq. However, a few hypothetical scenarios got me thinking:

  1. What happens if the Sorcerer becomes Neutral King? Does it become impossible for Inquisitors to win, or can they still kill a magic neutral king?
  2. After an Inquisitor kills a Sorcerer, if they become Neutral King, can they still lose?
  3. Does Cult King die if Inq attacks him?

Thanks in advance.
